001package io.github.ai4ci.output;
002
003import java.util.stream.Stream;
004
005import org.immutables.value.Value;
006
007import io.github.ai4ci.abm.Outbreak;
008import io.github.ai4ci.flow.output.DuckDBWriter;
009import io.github.ai4ci.flow.output.Export;
010import io.github.ai4ci.flow.output.Export.Stage;
011
012/**
013 * Person demographic records exported at simulation start.
014 *
015 * <p>
016 * Main purpose: provide per‑agent demographic and baseline attributes such as
017 * age, mobility baseline and location. Records are produced at the START stage
018 * and are written per agent to a DuckDB database ({@code demog.duckdb}).
019 *
020 * <p>
021 * Downstream uses: used for descriptive statistics, stratified analyses and as
022 * a join table for other per‑agent outputs such as line lists.
023 *
024 * @author Rob Challen
025 */
026@Value.Immutable
027@Export(
028                stage = Stage.START,
029                value = "demog.duckdb",
030                size = 16,
031                selector = PersonDemographicsCSV.Selector.class,
032                writer = DuckDBWriter.class
033)
034public interface PersonDemographicsCSV extends CommonCSV.Execution {
035
036        /**
037         * Selector for person demographic records. This is used to extract the
038         * relevant data from the outbreak at the START stage and map it to
039         * PersonDemographicsCSV records for export.
040         */
041        static class Selector implements Export.Selector {
042                @Override
043                public Stream<PersonDemographicsCSV> apply(Outbreak o) {
044                        return o.getPeople().stream().map(CSVMapper.INSTANCE::toDemog);
045                }
046        }
047
048        /**
049         * Age of the person.
050         *
051         * @return the person's age in years as a double to permit fractional ages
052         */
053        double getAge();
054
055        /**
056         * Baseline probability the person uses a contact tracing app.
057         *
058         * @return the app use probability in range 0–1
059         */
060        double getAppUseProbability();
061
062        /**
063         * Baseline compliance level for the person.
064         *
065         * @return the compliance baseline scalar used to model adherence to
066         *         interventions
067         */
068        double getComplianceBaseline();
069
070        /**
071         * Unique identifier for the person.
072         *
073         * @return the id used to join records for the same individual across
074         *         exported tables
075         */
076        int getId();
077
078        /**
079         * X coordinate of the person's spatial location normalised to [0,1].
080         *
081         * @return the normalised X location used for spatial analysis and joining to
082         *         raster or spatial models
083         */
084        double getLocationX();
085
086        /**
087         * Y coordinate of the person's spatial location normalised to [0,1].
088         *
089         * @return the normalised Y location used for spatial analysis and joining to
090         *         raster or spatial models
091         */
092        double getLocationY();
093
094        /**
095         * Baseline mobility value for the person.
096         *
097         * @return the baseline mobility scalar used as the starting point for
098         *         mobility adjustments
099         */
100        double getMobilityBaseline();
101
102        // double getExpectedContactDegree();
103
104}
